For trees, only about 1% of this carbon is actually bioactive. About 99% of a tree is dead.

Carbon kilograms are a way to measure biomass independent of water content. For humans, carbon is about 1/2 of our dry mass and 1/5 of our wet mass. So multiplying our carbon mass by 5 will give our total mass. For organisms with different densities, you multiply by a different number.
